TOTAL_PAGES: 1: Loxo's targeted drug helps variety of advanced cancers in small study
column7: Three quarters of patients with a wide  variety of advanced cancers responded to a Loxo Oncology Inc  therapy that targets a specific genetic defect,  according to data from a small study presented on Saturday at  the year's most important oncology meeting.  The drug, larotrectinib, directly targets an acquired rather  than inherited genetic defect called TRK fusions.  In such  patients, TRK genes abnormally attach to other genes, triggering  accelerated cancer cell growth.
